intro: Ranunculus kopetdaghensis, commonly known as the Kopetdag buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to the Kopetdag region in Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It has palmate leaves with lobed edges, and its flowers bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
